label: A Petitioner's Letter for the St. Andrew's Society
description: A letter from a man seeking financial aid from the St. Andrew's Society based on his destitution, lack of home, and being new to Charleston. The letter makes note of correspondence being lost which was meant to be sent to the St. Andrew's Society on behalf of the petitioner.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
[Top left corner] with papers of 1755

Charles Town Janry 15th

Sir,

I have made bold to write to you and with all have sent you the particulars of my unhappy circumstances which has find need of a pence of your goodness and charity to apply to you for some present relief being fairly destitute of money and other necessaries of life so that I hope you'll be prevailed on to send me some relief as you shall think proper; Mr. Rory wrote to you by me but unfortunately lost the lost the letter; I have wrote Mr. Mickie on the same accot.[account] but have referred him to you for particulars which I hope you'll present him for his personal; I am entirely at a loss being a stranger in town and have neither house nor home, under this distress I presently rely entirely on your goodness and remain

Worthy Sir,

Your distressed hble [humble] servant[?]

Sus.[Susan] Nouion[?]
